conclusion: Shadows are formed when an object blocks light. The position and size of the shadow depend on the position of the light source relative to the object, the distance between the light source and the object, and the angle at which light hits the object.
The light source is positioned such that it casts shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground. The objects are positioned in a way that their shadows fall at specific points on the ground.

premise: When the light source moves backward, it increases the distance between the light source and the objects.
conclusion: The angle at which the light hits the objects changes, causing the shadows to move.

premise: Shadows move in the direction opposite to the direction in which the light source moves.
conclusion: Since the light source moves backward, shadows will move forward (toward the objects).

premise: As the light source moves farther away from the objects, the light rays become more parallel.
conclusion: The shadows will generally become smaller.
Shadow A corresponds to the cake object.

premise: Shadow A corresponds to the cake object. When the light source moves backward, shadows move forward toward the objects.
conclusion: Shadow A moves forward toward the cake.

premise: As the light source moves farther away, shadows become smaller.
conclusion: Shadow A becomes smaller in size.
Shadow B corresponds to the black object.

premise: Shadow B corresponds to the black object. When the light source moves backward, shadows move forward toward the objects.
conclusion: Shadow B moves forward toward the black object.

premise: As the light source moves farther away, shadows become smaller.
conclusion: Shadow B becomes smaller in size.
Shadow C corresponds to the sandals object.

premise: Shadow C corresponds to the sandals object. When the light source moves backward, shadows move forward toward the objects.
conclusion: Shadow C moves forward toward the sandals.

premise: As the light source moves farther away, shadows become smaller.
conclusion: Shadow C becomes smaller in size.
Shadow D corresponds to the metal object.
